thread.title: Injury forces Kell Brook to withdraw from IBF welterweight title defence
thread.title_full: Injury forces Kell Brook to withdraw from IBF welterweight title defence

title: Injury forces Kell Brook to withdraw from IBF welterweight title defence
text:
Injury forces Kell Brook to withdraw from IBF welterweight title defence 16 Oct 2015 15:02:08 
comments 
Kell Brook has withdrawn from his IBF welterweight title defence against Argentina's Diego Chavez on October 24 after suffering a rib injury while sparring. 
Chris Eubank Jnr's fight, his first since signing with promoters Matchroom, against America's Tony Jeter will instead headline the Sheffield Arena bill. 
Following advice received after scans on his injury, the third defence of Brook's IBF title is to be rescheduled for later this year. 
"It's always a bitter blow when an injury causes a fight to be postponed, especially so close to the event," said promoter Eddie Hearn. 
"Kell picked up a rib injury in sparring (on Thursday) and spent most of the day at hospital. 
"Kell was desperate to fight but it was simply impossible and we will now look to reschedule the bout for the end of the year." Related Sport News
